intro: Sida timoriensis, commonly known as Timor sida, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to tropical climates.
